branches.name: feature/weighted-edits
branches.rationale: To enhance similarity scoring by allowing certain character substitutions to count differently in edit distance calculations.
risk_notes: Changes in scoring logic may affect existing tests.

commits.title: Implement distance_with_weights method
commits.body: Added a new method to calculate edit distance with weighted character substitutions.

commits.title: Expose distance_with_weights in the API
commits.body: Updated the __init__.py to include the new method in the public API.
per_file_changes: Added distance_with_weights to the module exports.

commits.title: Update documentation for distance_with_weights
commits.body: Updated the documentation to include usage examples for the new method.

commits.title: Add tests for distance_with_weights
commits.body: Created unit tests to validate the behavior of distance_with_weights under various scenarios.

branches.name: feature/max-distance-cutoff
branches.rationale: To improve performance by allowing the distance method to return early for inputs exceeding a specified threshold.

src/Levenshtein/__init__.py: Expose distance(s1, s2, max_dist=N) in the API
docs/levenshtein.rst: Update documentation for distance(s1, s2, max_dist=N)
tests/test_levenshtein_distance.py: Add tests for distance(s1, s2, max_dist=N)

risk_notes: May affect performance and existing tests.

commits.title: Implement distance(s1, s2, max_dist=N) method

branches.name: feature/multi-threaded-batch-computation
branches.rationale: To allow faster processing of large lists of strings for similarity ranking through parallel computation.

commits.title: Implement batch_distance(list1, list2, threads=T) method
commits.body: Added a new method to compute distances in batches using multiple threads.

commits.title: Expose batch_distance in the API

commits.body: Updated the documentation to include usage examples for the new method.

commits.title: Add tests for batch_distance
commits.body: Created unit tests to validate the behavior of batch_distance under various scenarios.

branches.rationale: To provide detailed insights into the edit operations performed during distance calculations.

branches.name: feature/unicode-grapheme-clusters
branches.rationale: To ensure multi-codepoint characters are treated as single units in distance calculations, improving correctness.
risk_notes: May affect performance and existing tests.

commits.title: Implement use_graphemes=True parameter
commits.body: Added a new optional parameter to handle grapheme clusters.

commits.title: Expose use_graphemes in the API
commits.body: Updated the __init__.py to include the new parameter in the public API.
per_file_changes: Added use_graphemes to the module exports.

commits.title: Update documentation for use_graphemes
commits.body: Updated the documentation to include usage examples for the new parameter.

commits.title: Add tests for use_graphemes
commits.body: Created unit tests to validate the behavior of use_graphemes under various scenarios.

branches.name: feature/pure-python-fallback
branches.rationale: To maintain functionality on platforms where the C extension cannot compile, enhancing portability.

src/Levenshtein/__init__.py: Expose fallback module in the API

risk_notes: Fallback may not cover all edge cases.

commits.title: Implement fallback logic
commits.body: Added a pure-Python fallback module for compatibility.

commits.title: Expose fallback module in the API
commits.body: Updated the __init__.py to include the fallback module in the public API.
